titleStmt.title: E. M. Angel to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5417

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: E M Angel States that he is now & that he has been Dep Pro Mar for Green County Since the Summer of 1862 He states that he is acquainted with John R Redman That Said Redman for Some time made his home at one Frank Beachamps in Said County He states that Said Redman was looked upon with Suspicion by the citizens of said county He states that he had no apparent business in the county and that his acts and associations were well calculated to create suspicion He states that he has been solicited to arrest Said Redman denies times and that he has been accused of a number of Offenses, but that he could never get Sufficient evidence to insure his Conviction He States that Said Redman associated with men of knon bad Character, Some of whom are now acting in concert with Guerillas and that his ( business (if he had any) in Green County was carefully concealed from the Public He States that Said Redman is not a resident of Green County and So far as he can ascertain his residence is not known

E M Angel
Dept Prov Marshal 4th Dist Ky
We the undersigned Citizens State that we fully concur in the above statement of Dep Pro Mar Angel

D T Lowles
W. N. Vaughan
Thos J. Town
